data.title: CoreWeave Stock Earnings Are Coming – Here's What This Top Analyst Expects
data.description:
CoreWeave (NASDAQ:CRWV) is set to announce its 4Q25 results today after the close, the readout coming at a rocky moment for AI-related stocks. Even so, CoreWeave seems to be positioned on the right side of the trade as investor appetite continues to lean toward companies that own and operate AI-focused data centers, and that is where CoreWeave's value proposition lies. To wit, year-to-date, the shares have climbed 37%.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

It's all about triple-digit revenue growth at the rapidly expanding AI cloud infrastructure specialist, and that metric will be a focus for Wall Street. Revenue is anticipated to increase by 101% to $1.5 billion.

However, Evercore's Amit Daryanani, an analyst ranked among the top 2% on Wall Street, believes the company can beat that figure given what he views as a "de-risked setup." Recall that in the prior quarter management reduced its CY25 revenue guide to account for temporary delays in delivering powered-shell data center capacity in Q4.

He also sees potential to outperform the Street's $138 million EBIT forecast, though EPS may be harder to model accurately as CRWV continues investing to scale operations.

For the December quarter, Daryanani thinks investor attention will center on the schedule for powered-shell data center deliveries, progress in locking in incremental long-term capacity and the funding environment – with the broadened NVIDIA partnership viewed as a supportive factor – as well as the read-through for CY26 revenue.

Recent reporting referencing internal memos about a "chip delivery milestone" at a facility in Denton, Texas, indicated that more than 16,000 GPUs were operational by late December and that total data center capacity could approach roughly 850 MW by year-end. Against that backdrop, the analyst thinks the Q1 Street revenue forecast of about $2.3 billion appears attainable. Daryanani sees the Q4 backlog landing in the mid-to-high $50 billion range, largely unchanged from Q3, as the company prioritizes securing additional data center capacity, with revenue primarily constrained by supply rather than demand.

Additional topics investors will be monitoring include the transition from Blackwell to Rubin and how the ramp timing could affect revenue; availability of powered-shell data center capacity, including updates on self-built facilities; and the strategy to generate revenue from software offerings such as SUNK and Mission Control by selling them to other cloud providers. Overall, while strong demand and the debate over GPU useful life – with several data points suggesting GPUs can remain productive for more than 10 years – are well understood, the 5-star analyst thinks attention has increasingly shifted toward CRWV's ability to secure the capacity required to sustain future expansion.

All told, Daryanani maintained an Outperform (i.e., Buy) rating on the shares, backed by a $160 price target that points toward 12-month returns of 65%. (To watch Daryanani's track record, click here)

The rest of the Street's ratings splits into an even 8 Buys and Holds, each, all culminating in a Moderate Buy consensus rating. At $118.57, the average target implies shares will gain 22% over the one-year timeframe. (See CRWV stock forecast)
data.author: Marty Shtrubel

data.title: Dow Jones Today: DJIA Slips as Nvidia's Earnings Fail to Impress; Jobless Claims Tick Higher
data.description:
The Dow Jones (DJIA) is trading lower on Thursday as investors digest a key earnings report from Nvidia (NVDA) and labor market data from the Department of Labor (DOL).

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

For the quarter ended December 31, Nvidia reported revenue growth of 73% to $68.10 billion with an adjusted EPS of $1.62. Both figures came above the analysts' estimates of $66.23 billion and $1.54, respectively. In addition, the semiconductor leader provided fiscal first quarter revenue guidance of $78 billion, plus or minus 2%, which was above the estimate of $72.6 billion as well.

However, the results weren't good enough for investors, with NVDA selling off amid continued fears of a bubble in AI. Investors are also concerned about the company's customer concentration and whether the company can continue to grow rapidly if AI spending cools down. NVDA holds a 2.34% weight in the Dow Jones.

Several analysts defended Nvidia following its report. Cantor Fitzgerald analyst C.J. Muse emphasized that the company "gets no respect" and remains undervalued with strong AI demand. UBS analyst Timothy Arcuri said that it's "hard to see" why NVDA is trading lower when it reported such strong numbers and maintained his price target of $245 and "buy" rating. Both analysts are ranked by TipRanks as five-star analysts.

Meanwhile, the DOL announced that initial jobless claims rose by 4,000 to 212,000, below the consensus estimate of 216,000, for the week ended February 21. Continuing jobless claims, which trail initial claims by a week, fell by 31,000 to 1.833 million and were below the expectation of 1.858 million. Initial jobless claims serve as a gauge of layoffs, while continuing jobless claims track the number of people receiving unemployment benefits and reflect ongoing unemployment.

The Dow Jones is down by 0.39% at the time of writing.
data.author: Eddie Pan

data.title: PayPal Stock Sinks after Report Says Stripe Isn't Interested in a Takeover
data.description:
Despite recent rumors, PayPal (PYPL) is not actively seeking a buyer and is not in negotiations with Stripe or any other company. Instead, insiders say that the fintech firm has been quietly preparing for months to defend itself against potential activist investors or hostile takeover attempts, according to Semafor. This precautionary move came after a sharp drop in PayPal's stock price raised concerns that the company could become vulnerable. Although Bloomberg reported that Stripe has explored acquiring PayPal, the company has declined to comment on the speculation.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

However, even if Stripe wanted to proceed, pulling off such a deal would be extremely challenging. Because Stripe is privately owned, it cannot use publicly traded shares as currency in a merger, which is how many large acquisitions are financed. Instead, it would need an enormous amount of debt financing to fund a cash purchase, especially if PayPal resisted. Deals of this scale between private buyers and public targets are rare and often require complex financial engineering.

Still, the strategic logic behind the interest is easy to understand. PayPal controls a large network of users and payment infrastructure that is deeply embedded in global commerce, making it a highly attractive asset for any major fintech player. However, any meaningful discussions would likely have to wait until PayPal's leadership transition settles and the company clarifies its long-term strategy. For now, the firm appears focused on protecting its independence rather than entertaining offers, which caused its stock to drop in today's trading.

Is PYPL Stock a Good Buy?

Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Hold consensus rating on PYPL stock based on five Buys, 26 Holds, and four Sells assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below. Furthermore, the average PYPL price target of $51.35 per share implies 13.5% upside potential.
data.author: Vince Condarcuri

data.title: 10-Year Treasury Yield Slides to 3-Month Low as Geopolitical Uncertainty Spikes Higher
data.description:
The 10-year Treasury yield is down by 3.1 bps to 4.017% on Thursday, marking its lowest level since late November.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

The move comes as the U.S. and Iran hold indirect talks in Geneva over a potential nuclear deal. In recent weeks, the U.S. has bolstered its military presence in the Middle East to pressure Tehran into signing a deal, although key disagreements remain.

The 10-year note is viewed as a safe-haven asset and tends to benefit during periods of geopolitical uncertainty. As a reminder, the yield on the note moves in the opposite direction of its price.

Trump-Xi Summit Faces Preparation Shortfalls

Elsewhere, the South China Morning Post reported that preparations for the Trump-Xi summit have fallen short, driven by a lack of communication between the two sides.

"The less preparation that is undertaken in advance of Trump's arrival in Beijing, the greater the potential for surprise and disappointment," said Ryan Hass, a former National Security Council director.

Analysts warn that a lack of preparation could result in fewer positive outcomes for both sides, including trade negotiations, rare earths, and aircraft sales.
data.author: Eddie Pan

data.title: Nutanix Stock (NTNX) Rallies on a Deal with AMD
data.description:
Nutanix (NTNX) stock rallied on Thursday after the enterprise cloud platform company announced a partnership with chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices (AMD). This agreement will have the two companies collaborate to create "an open, full-stack AI infrastructure platform designed to power agentic AI applications."

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Nutanix also announced that as part of its agreement with AMD, the latter has decided to make an investment in NTNX stock. AMD will purchase $150 million in NTNX stock at a purchase price of $36.26 per share. In addition to this, AMD will invest $100 million to support Nutanix's joint engineering initiatives and the go-to-market collaboration that will accelerate the development of the open, full-stack AI infrastructure platform.

Tarkan Maner, President and Chief Commercial Officer of Nutanix, said, "Our partnership with AMD reflects a shared vision for scalable, production-ready AI infrastructure. Together, we are delivering full-stack, integrated platforms optimized for inference and agentic applications across hybrid environments for enterprises and service providers."

Nutanix Stock Movement Today

Nutanix stock was up 3.38% on Thursday, but is still down 22.52% year-to-date. The shares have also fallen 49.78% over the past 12 months.

Today's news resulted in heavy trading of NTNX stock, as more than 5.4 million shares changed hands. For comparison, the company's three-month daily average trading volume is about 4.32 million shares.

Nutanix isn't the only company that saw its stock rally today on AMD-related news. Avalon GloboCare (ALBT) stock rocketed higher after it was accepted into the AMD AI Developer Program.
data.author: William White

data.title: Nvidia Stock Is Down but This Top Analyst Keeps Street-High Price Target Following Blowout Earnings
data.description:
In what appeared to be almost a given, Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) delivered the goods in its fiscal fourth quarter report, handily beating Street estimates and guiding above expectations.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

But that just won't do these days. In a bizarre kind of way, that kind of outstanding performance has become par for the course for the chip giant, and investors' reaction to the print has been a negative one, with shares down 5% in Thursday's trading as of writing. Right now, the market seems reluctant to reward anything AI-related, no matter the strength on display.

The Street's biggest NVDA bull, however, has no such issues. "We view the risk/reward positive post a beat/raise quarter," said Evercore's Mark Lipacis, an analyst ranked among the top 1% on Wall Street.

Lipacis thinks the stock will outperform eventually as investors gain clarity on two key concerns. The first is whether CapEx growth can continue beyond 2027. In short, Lipacis thinks it can. While many liken today's AI spending to the Internet bubble of 2000, Lipacis points out two crucial distinctions: first, the Internet was a medium "looking for an app," whereas AI is the application in search of compute cycles; second, internet infrastructure spending happened before returns were realized, while AI investment is being funded by actual returns. For instance, AI spending has driven a 35%-90% rise in revenue per employee over the past three years at hyperscalers, reducing costs in both software and headcount. The analyst believes AI-driven savings on $60 trillion in global OpEx are already financing current AI investments. In other words, AI CapEx isn't entirely new spending – it's largely a reallocation, shifting money from enterprise OpEx to the CapEx of hyperscalers, neoclouds, model developers, and enterprises. With current hyperscale CapEx at $1 trillion, less than 2% of global OpEx, Lipacis thinks there is "more to go."

The second concern is whether demand for AI tokens can sustain its "parabolic growth." Here, too, Lipacis believes it can. Agentic AI represents a "change in the paradigm" for compute demand. In prior computing eras, such as PCs or smartphones, demand was constrained by the number of people – 8 billion people can only purchase so many devices. With Agentic AI, multiple autonomous agents can operate simultaneously on behalf of individuals or businesses, interacting with other agents in parallel. This creates virtually unlimited demand for AI tokens. "Agentic AI has only just started, we expect parabolic growth demand for tokens will continue," the 5-star analyst summed up.

Bottom line, Lipacis maintained an Outperform (i.e., Buy) rating on the shares, alongside his Street-high price target of $352, implying the stock will gain 90% in the year ahead. (To watch Lipacis' track record, click here)

Turning to the general Street view, NVDA stock's Strong Buy consensus rating is based on 36 Buys vs. 1 Hold and Sell, each. At $272.65, the average target offers 12-month upside of 47%. (See Nvidia stock forecast)
data.author: Marty Shtrubel

data.title: Why Is the Stock Market Down Today, 2/26/26?
data.description:
Both the S&P 500 (SPX) and the Nasdaq 100 (NDX) are trading lower on Thursday as a blowout earnings report from Nvidia (NVDA) failed to subdue concerns about a bubble in AI.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

NVDA is the largest holding in both SPX and NDX, with weights of 7.32% and 13.57%, respectively. Despite the semiconductor leader beating on revenue, adjusted EPS, and guidance, investors chose to focus on customer concentration risk and the uncertainty of revenue from China amid restrictive regulatory measures.

Software, Financial Stocks Shine as Mega Caps Slide

Other members of the Magnificent 7, including Alphabet (GOOGL), Amazon (AMZN), and Tesla (TSLA), are also showing weakness alongside semiconductor stocks like Broadcom (AVGO) and Micron (MU).

However, software stocks are a bright spot on the day, with ServiceNow (NOW), CrowdStrike (CRWD), and Datadog (DDOG) all up by at least 4%. The financial sector is also catching a bid as the "rotational bull market" continues, said Piper Sandler Chief Market Technician Craig Johnson.
data.author: Eddie Pan

data.title: Mastercard Stock Rises as MetaMask Launches its MA Debit Card as Crypto Spending Hits Mainstreet USA
data.description:
The wall between your crypto wallet and your morning coffee has finally crumbled. Mastercard (MA) and MetaMask announced the official U.S. launch of their joint crypto debit card. This rollout is a massive win for the industry because it includes New York, a state known for having the toughest crypto rules in the country. Now, almost any American can use their digital assets to pay for groceries, gas, or even a Netflix subscription. The news sent Mastercard's stock up by 1.2% in early trading on Thursday.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Mastercard Integration Provides Global Reach

The secret to this card's success is the massive network provided by Mastercard. Instead of trying to build a new payment system from scratch, MetaMask is plugging directly into Mastercard's existing ecosystem. This means you can use the card at over 150 million stores and websites worldwide.

Partnering with a giant like Mastercard gives crypto the stamp of approval it needs for everyday use. When you tap your phone to pay, the Mastercard network handles the heavy lifting, turning your crypto into dollars in the blink of an eye. This integration allows users to keep their money in the digital world while still being able to spend it in the physical one.

Self-Custody Tech Keeps You in Control

Unlike traditional crypto cards, which act like a bank account where the company holds your money, the MetaMask Card is different. It uses self-custody technology, which means the tokens stay in your private wallet until the exact second you make a purchase. You are the only person with the keys to your funds.

Retaining full control of your assets is a huge selling point for people who don't trust big exchanges. Most other cards require you to pre-load money onto an exchange, which can be slow and risky. With this new setup, the money only leaves your wallet when you say so. This creates a much safer and faster experience for everyone involved.

Stablecoin Support Reduces Market Risk

To make spending more predictable, the card focuses on stablecoins like USDC and USDT. Because these tokens are pegged to the U.S. dollar, you don't have to worry about the price of your coffee money crashing while you are standing in line. The card also supports Ethereum (ETH-USD) for those who want to spend their gains directly.

Focusing on stablecoins is a smart move for mainstream adoption. It makes crypto feel more like a regular checking account and less like a gamble. As more people move their paychecks into stablecoins to earn higher interest, having a Mastercard that can spend those funds instantly makes the bankless lifestyle a very real option for millions of Americans.

Is Mastercard Still a Good Stock?

On TipRanks, Nvidia stock commands a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 25 Buy and three Hold ratings. The average 12-month MA price target of $660 implies 28.3% upside potential from current levels. Over the past year, MA shares have fallen 9.24%.
data.author: Annika Masrani

data.title: Fed's Miran Urges Four Rate Cuts in 2026 with 'Broadly Stable' Inflation
data.description:
Fed Governor Stephen Miran reiterated his call for the Fed to cut interest rates by 100 bps this year, citing the disinflationary effects of AI amid "broadly stable" prices. Miran added that risks to the labor market are still present, paving the way for lower rates to support employment.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

"One difference between me and some of my colleagues is that I don't think we have an inflation problem," he told Fox Business on Thursday.

Portfolio Fees Add Pressure to Core PCE Inflation, Says Miran

Higher stock market prices have contributed to elevated portfolio management fees. These fees have added 0.4% to the core Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) Index, which last came in at 3%, said Miran. Core PCE is the Fed's preferred inflation gauge and tracks changes in consumer spending while excluding volatile food and energy prices.

The Fed will hold its next Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting on March 18, though a rate cut appears unlikely, with the odds at just 2% according to the CME FedWatch tool.
data.author: Eddie Pan
